cyclone.name: HUMBERTO
cyclone.current_location: about 280 mi ESE of Freeport, Grand Bahama Island
cyclone.trajectory: Moving northwest-to-north-northwest across the north-central Bahamas, then forecast to track just offshore the Florida east coast and turn northward toward Georgia/South Carolina early next week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Brushes the east-central Florida coast (near Cape Canaveral) – no clear inland landfall presently forecast

weather_observation.watch_coast: Jupiter Inlet northward to the Flagler-Volusia County line (east-central FL)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida east coast from Jupiter Inlet northward through Georgia and coastal South Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph gusts) possible Saturday night through early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation possible, but significant surge not expected
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches of rain with localized heavier pockets could cause brief urban/low-lying flooding
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and occasional squalls affecting vessel approaches
